required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Therapeutic Effect of New Biologics in Crohn's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Therapeutic Effect of New Biologics in Crohn's Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Sixth Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-sen University

clinical_study.source: Sixth Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-sen University

brief_summary.textblock: New types of biologics have brought advantages in therapy strategies for Crohn's disease. However, clinical data evaluating their efficacy and adverse in China is lacking. We aimed to evaluate the short-term and long-term therapeutic effect as well as drug adverse of Ustekinumab (UST) and Vedolizumab (VED). Besides, we aim to figure out the independent factors predicting the effectiveness of new biologics. Relations between drug exposure (trough concentration and antibody concentration) and therapeutic efficacy are study in-depth by this retrospective observational study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: short-time efficacy (16-20 weeks or 24 weeks) and long-term efficacy (52~54weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Endoscopic remission referred to those with simple endoscopic score for Crohn's disease (SES-CD)â‰¤2

secondary_outcome.time_frame: short-time efficacy (16-20 weeks or 24 weeks) and long-term efficacy (52~54weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical remission was defined as Crohn's disease activity index (CDAI) below 150

secondary_outcome.time_frame: short-time efficacy (16-20 weeks or 24 weeks) and long-term efficacy (52~54weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: endoscopic response referred to those with a reduction of SES-CD > 50% baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: short-time efficacy (16-20 weeks or 24 weeks) and long-term efficacy (52~54weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: endoscopic response referred to those with a reduction of SES-CD > 50% baseline

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive adult patients with confirmed diagnosis of Crohn's disease and administration of new type biologics

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Consecutive adult patients with confirmed diagnosis of Crohn's disease and administration of new type biologics.
Exclusion Criteria:
- loss of follow-up, incomplete clinical data, without confirmed diagnosis

facility.name: the Sixth Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University
